evidence_items.text: During an airfield inspection at TUPJ, which began at 1900 hrs Z on 6 November, it was found that a frangible light at the western edge of the Rwy 07 undershoot was missing. Tyre marks were also discovered on the extreme end of the runway. Based on the nature of the marks, their orientation and location, as well as the track between them, it was determined they were made by an aircraft rather than a ground vehicle. The airfield boundary fence in the Rwy 07 undershoot had also sustained damage. The barbed wire support arm on one fence pole was missing and the wire had been severed in that location.

Safety reporting With damage to airfield infrastructure having been found, the airfield duty manager submitted a Mandatory Occurrence Report (MOR) to Air Safety Support International (ASSI) on 9 November 2024. In the MOR, the event type was recorded as ‘ Incident.’ Following a review of the report, ASSI reclassified the event as a Serious Incident and notified the AAIB on 6 January 2025.

Unaware that the aircraft had struck any obstacles on the approach, the flight crew did not submit a safety report about the landing but provided the following brief statement on 8 November 2024 in response to the TUPJ airfield authorities’ enquiries.

‘On November 6 the weather was marginal with rain on all quadrants, upon approaching runway 7 on short final started to experience wind gusts and probably a downdraft [sic], seemed close to a low-level wind shear. Applied power to arrest the descent. I landed slightly short of the numbers. I was totally unaware that I struck [anything].’ Although they were requested from the commander, further details of the occurrence, which could have provided greater insight into the content and context of their 8 November statement, were not provided to the AAIB.

ICAO Annex (Aircraft Accident and Incident Investigation) Attachment C lists typical examples of incidents that are likely to be classified as serious. This list includes: ‘Take-off or landing incidents. Incidents such as under-shooting, overrunning or running off the side of runways.’ The operator did not instigate an internal safety review for this serious incident.
Personnel The commander did not supply the investigation with details of their flight licence, medical status, flying experience or recency.

Meteorology The reports submitted to the AAIB did not contain meteorological information, but the UK Met Office generated a limited aftercast for the time of the serious incident. The report found that: ● The weather conditions on the day were characterised by light east to north easterly winds with scattered cloud.
● The TUPJ TAF included a risk of thunderstorms from 1800 hrs UTC, with an associated forecast reduction in visibility and cloud bases.

On arrival at Terrance B Lettsome International Airport (TUPJ) in the British Virgin Islands, N915GD was likely affected by nearby thunderstorm activity, reportedly experiencing a downdraught on short finals. Despite the commander applying more power to “arrest the descent”, the aircraft initially touched down on the lip of Runway (Rwy 07), approximately 150 m short of the threshold. It then bounced and touched down again close to the threshold.
The airfield operations team later found a frangible runway light had been damaged by the aircraft when it undershot the runway.

While he knew the aircraft initially touched down in the undershoot, the commander was unaware that it had struck the light and did not file an occurrence report. The aircraft returned to its home base approximately one hour later.

children_spec.statement: Crew members were physically present and reachable during the operation
children_spec.test_procedure: Check logs, timestamps, and communication records to verify crew presence and availability

children_spec.statement: Communication devices and channels were operational and accessible to all crew members
children_spec.test_procedure: Test communication equipment functionality and review maintenance records and usage logs

children_spec.statement: Crew members were not engaged in conflicting tasks that prevented timely communication
children_spec.test_procedure: Analyze task assignments and workload during the operation to identify potential conflicts

children_spec.statement: Mechanical components required for control were physically present and intact
children_spec.test_procedure: Inspect maintenance records and physical condition to verify presence and integrity of mechanical control components

children_spec.statement: Mechanical control components were accessible and not obstructed during operation
children_spec.test_procedure: Examine cockpit and control linkage areas for any obstructions or access issues during the incident timeframe

children_spec.statement: Mechanical control components were free from failure modes such as breakage, jamming, or disconnection
children_spec.test_procedure: Conduct mechanical inspections and failure analysis on control components to detect any physical or functional failures

children_spec.statement: Mechanical control system was properly maintained and serviced according to operational standards
children_spec.test_procedure: Review maintenance logs and service records for compliance with required mechanical control system upkeep

children_spec.statement: Crew members failed to share critical flight information in a timely manner
children_spec.test_procedure: Review cockpit voice recordings and communication logs to identify delays or omissions in information sharing

children_spec.statement: Crew did not follow established communication protocols during the flight
children_spec.test_procedure: Compare crew communication behavior against standard operating procedures and checklists

children_spec.statement: There was confusion or misunderstanding among crew members about roles and responsibilities
children_spec.test_procedure: Analyze crew statements and actions for evidence of role ambiguity or misinterpretation

children_spec.statement: External communication with air traffic control was inadequate or misinterpreted by the crew
children_spec.test_procedure: Examine ATC transcripts and crew responses for communication errors or misunderstandings

children_spec.statement: Relevant environmental data (e.g., weather, lighting) was available for the time of the incident
children_spec.test_procedure: Check if weather and lighting reports or recordings exist for the incident time; absence or presence affects probability

children_spec.statement: Marking information (e.g., signage, runway markings) was documented and accessible for the incident location
children_spec.test_procedure: Verify if official records or photographs of markings at the incident site exist; lack of documentation lowers availability

children_spec.statement: Environmental and marking data were retrievable and usable by investigators during the analysis
children_spec.test_procedure: Assess if investigators had access to and could interpret environmental and marking data; inability reduces availability

children_spec.statement: The environmental conditions at the time of the incident match the key features identified in the investigation
children_spec.test_procedure: Compare recorded environmental data (weather, visibility, lighting) with the key features documented in the investigation report to confirm alignment or discrepancies

children_spec.statement: The physical markings (signage, runway markings, lighting) at the incident location correspond to the key features identified as deficient
children_spec.test_procedure: Inspect and document the physical markings present at the site and compare them against the key features of marking deficiencies noted in the investigation

children_spec.statement: The environmental or marking deficiencies identified are consistent with the operational context of the Short Bros SD3-60 N915GD on 10-25
children_spec.test_procedure: Review operational records and incident context to verify that the deficiencies align with the aircraft and date-specific conditions

children_spec.statement: Availability of updated pushback procedure documentation to the crew
children_spec.test_procedure: Check if the crew had access to the latest pushback procedure manuals or bulletins before the flight

children_spec.statement: Availability of required ground support equipment for pushback
children_spec.test_procedure: Verify if the necessary ground equipment was present and operational at the time of pushback

children_spec.statement: Availability of trained personnel to perform or supervise pushback
children_spec.test_procedure: Confirm if qualified ground crew or personnel were available and assigned for pushback operations

children_spec.statement: Pushback procedure deviated from standard communication protocols
children_spec.test_procedure: Review recorded communications and verify if standard phraseology and callouts were used; deviations would lower probability

children_spec.statement: Pushback procedure deviated from standard vehicle positioning and movement steps
children_spec.test_procedure: Analyze pushback vehicle telemetry and video to confirm adherence to prescribed positioning and movement sequences; deviations would lower probability

children_spec.statement: Pushback procedure deviated from required safety checks before and during pushback
children_spec.test_procedure: Check maintenance logs and crew reports for completion of safety checks; missing or incomplete checks would lower probability

children_spec.statement: Environmental conditions did not degrade the visibility or legibility of markings
children_spec.test_procedure: Assess weather, lighting, and environmental factors at the time to determine if markings were obscured or faded

children_spec.statement: Markings were applied according to regulatory standards and specifications
children_spec.test_procedure: Review maintenance and inspection records to verify compliance with marking standards

children_spec.statement: Markings remained physically intact and undamaged at the time of the event
children_spec.test_procedure: Conduct physical inspection or photographic evidence review to confirm absence of damage or wear

node.statement: Marking information (e.g., signage, runway markings) was documented and accessible for the incident location

assumptions: Frangible runway lights are considered part of marking information (e.g., signage, runway markings)
defeaters: If evidence showed that the marking information was not documented or accessible despite the light's presence
If the frangible light was not part of the documented marking information relevant to the incident location

quotes.exact_quote: The airfield operations team later found a frangible runway light had been damaged by the aircraft when it undershot the runway.

outcome.reasoning_summary: The presence of a frangible runway light, which is a type of marking information, was documented and found damaged at the incident location (S2). This indicates that marking information was documented and accessible.
outcome.uncertainty_source: The evidence does not explicitly state the extent or accessibility of all marking information, only the frangible light was mentioned.

children_spec.statement: Mechanical failure is consistent with observed damage patterns on the control surfaces
children_spec.test_procedure: Examine the control surfaces for damage patterns and compare them to known mechanical failure signatures; evidence inconsistent damage would lower probability

children_spec.statement: Control system components show signs of malfunction or wear consistent with failure
children_spec.test_procedure: Inspect control system components for malfunction indicators or wear; absence of such signs would lower probability

children_spec.statement: Flight data and maintenance records indicate prior issues or anomalies in mechanical control systems
children_spec.test_procedure: Review flight data and maintenance logs for anomalies related to mechanical control; lack of such evidence would lower probability

children_spec.statement: The mechanical control system components show no signs of wear or damage that would cause failure
children_spec.test_procedure: Inspect and test mechanical control components for wear, damage, or malfunction; evidence of such would lower confidence in defeater resistance

children_spec.statement: The control system's mechanical linkages resisted external forces without failure during the incident
children_spec.test_procedure: Analyze mechanical linkage integrity and resistance to applied forces during the event; failure or deformation would falsify this

children_spec.statement: Maintenance records confirm that mechanical control components were within service limits and properly maintained prior to the incident
children_spec.test_procedure: Review maintenance logs and service records; evidence of overdue or improper maintenance would lower defeater resistance

children_spec.statement: No external environmental factors (e.g., corrosion, contamination) compromised the mechanical control system's resistance to failure
children_spec.test_procedure: Examine environmental exposure and contamination levels; presence of such factors would falsify this statement

node.statement: Mechanical control system was properly maintained and serviced according to operational standards

defeaters: Evidence showing maintenance records or servicing logs confirming proper maintenance
Statements or reports indicating mechanical control system condition or failures related to maintenance
outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence in the provided items addresses the maintenance or servicing status of the mechanical control system according to operational standards.

children_spec.statement: Crew members failed to share critical information in a timely manner
children_spec.test_procedure: Review communication logs and interview crew to determine if critical information was delayed or omitted

children_spec.statement: Crew did not follow established coordination protocols during the event
children_spec.test_procedure: Examine procedural adherence through flight data and crew statements to identify deviations from coordination protocols

children_spec.statement: Communication equipment malfunctioned or was improperly used by the crew
children_spec.test_procedure: Inspect maintenance records and equipment status reports, and verify crew usage of communication devices

node.statement: Crew members were physically present and reachable during the operation

defeaters: Direct evidence showing crew members were physically present and reachable during the operation
Statements or reports confirming active communication or coordination among crew during the event

quotes.exact_quote: Unaware that the aircraft had struck any obstacles on the approach, the flight crew did not submit a safety report about the landing but provided the following brief statement on 8 November 2024 in response to the TUPJ airfield authorities’ enquiries.

‘On November 6 the weather was marginal with rain on all quadrants, upon approaching runway 7 on short final started to experience wind gusts and probably a downdraft [sic], seemed close to a low-level wind shear. Applied power to arrest the descent. I landed slightly short of the numbers. I was totally unaware that I struck [anything].’
While he knew the aircraft initially touched down in the undershoot, the commander was unaware that it had struck the light and did not file an occurrence report.

outcome.reasoning_summary: The evidence indicates the flight crew was unaware of striking obstacles and did not report any issues, implying they were likely present but not necessarily reachable or effectively communicating during the operation (H3, H4, S3). No direct evidence confirms physical presence and reachability of all crew members during the operation.
outcome.uncertainty_source: absence of direct statements or reports about crew physical presence and reachability during the operation

children_spec.statement: The procedural deviation was not corrected by the flight crew during pushback
children_spec.test_procedure: Review cockpit voice recordings and flight data to determine if the crew identified and corrected the deviation

children_spec.statement: Ground personnel did not intervene to prevent or correct the procedural deviation during pushback
children_spec.test_procedure: Examine ground crew reports and communications to verify if any intervention occurred

children_spec.statement: The aircraft systems did not provide alerts or warnings that could have prevented the procedural deviation
children_spec.test_procedure: Analyze aircraft system logs and alert records to check for absence of relevant warnings

node.statement: Availability of required ground support equipment for pushback

defeaters: Evidence showing presence or absence of ground support equipment for pushback at the time of the incident.
outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence in the provided items mentions the availability or unavailability of required ground support equipment for pushback.
